title: A Long Way Home
prompt: Think of something you wanted but felt hard to reach. What happened?
hint: For example: a dream, a place, an exam, or a personal goal.
sample: My goal was to pass an exam. I studied a little every day and didn’t give up. In the end, I felt proud.

title: I Have an Idea
prompt: Think of a time when you had a problem and tried a new idea. What happened?
hint: For example: missing the bus, forgetting homework, or getting lost.
sample: The problem was that I missed the bus. My idea was to use a map app and walk home. In the end, I got home safely.

title: Jump and Try
prompt: Think of something new you want to try, even if you feel a little nervous.
hint: For example: speaking English, trying a new sport, or learning a new skill.
sample: I want to try speaking English to new people. I feel nervous, but I want to try. I hope I will feel more confident.

title: I Am Floating
prompt: Think of a moment when you feel very relaxed, like you are floating.
hint: For example: listening to music, being in nature, or resting at home.
sample: I feel relaxed when I listen to music at night. My body feels calm and light. I forget my worries.

title: Almost There
prompt: Think of something you are working on and feel you are almost there.
hint: For example: learning English, exercising, or finishing a project.
sample: I am learning English now. I am not finished yet, but I am close. I will keep going.

title: You Made It!
prompt: Think of a time when you wanted to say "You made it!" to someone.
hint: For example: finishing an exam, a race, or a hard day.
sample: My friend finished a big exam. I said, "You made it!" to her. She was tired but very happy.

title: Don’t Give Up
prompt: Think of something that helps you not give up when things are hard.
hint: For example: a goal, a friend, or taking a short break.
sample: When things are hard, I think about my goal. It helps me stay calm. I keep going.

title: Feeling Safe at Home
prompt: Think of a place or person that makes you feel safe and at home.
hint: For example: your room, your family, or a favorite activity.
sample: I feel safe when I am in my room at night. It is quiet and familiar. I feel calm.
